page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: Efford is a residential area of Plymouth that was built just after the 2nd World War. The houses are mainly steel houses built by Italian and German prisoners of war. Most of the houses are rented by the City Council, but some of the houses have been sold to the tenants recently. The streets are named after rivers. There used to be a large estate of prefabricated houses (called prefabs) built during the 2nd World War, to house the people who had lost their homes in the war. these houses were made in factories and erected on site. This estate was called Little America because the streets were named after American States. There ia now an estate of new houses which is also called Little America on this site.
